article.headline: Portland St. 69, Montana St. 64
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. -- Charles Odum scored 16 points off the bench to lead Portland State to a 69-64 come-from-behind victory over Montana State on Saturday night. Phillip Thomas had 14 points for the Vikings (13-15, 5-10 Big Sky) and Melvin Jones added 10 points in Portland State's season finale. Danny Piepoli led Montana State (12-17, 6-9) with 19 points. Bobby Howard had 15 points for the Bobcats, who will play in the Big Sky tournament beginning next Saturday. Portland State trailed 57-49 with 6:15 remaining, but scored the next nine points, taking a 58-57 lead on Chehales Tapscott's lay-in with 2:53 to play. Montana State regained the lead on a jumper by Piepoli, but the Vikings went back in front and scored seven in a row, capped by Chris Harriel's two free throws with 28 seconds left. Portland State shot 41 percent while the Bobcats made 39 percent of their outside shots.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
